ygData.subject: Re: New armor info
ygData.msgSnippet: As far as the AC goes, I am expecting that it will fall in line with the fine steel plate AC with random right-clickable effects. (Hence the need for mana
ygData.messageBody:
As far as the AC goes, I am expecting that it will fall in line with
the fine steel plate AC with random "right-clickable" effects. (Hence
the need for mana batteries.) Will be off and running with the
footwarming boots, with my secondary tinkerer to attempt to find the
trivial point next week after I get back from my extended holiday
vacation.

Ghirardelli
E'ci

--- In EQ_Tinkering@egroups.com, "Norbert Gearsmith" <noes@d...>
wrote:
> Hmm...what is the trivial level for Footwarming Boots? They may be
> the missing link. If they are higher than aqualungs (148) and more
> economical than rebreathers, then they could help boost skill for
all
> of us tinkerers that are on a budget. Can someone post what they
> have found on the boot's trivial level? Also, can someone past 148
> make some boots to see if they increase skill about the same or
> better than rebreathers?
>
> This will help me a bunch in trying to put together a training
plan.
> Might also help someone increase their skill to the point where
they
> can make at least one piece of Watchman armor.
>
> I just want to know if Watchman armor is going to be worthwhile or
> not. I hope they give it decent AC and we don't have the
> mysteriously disappearing AC like we do for rebreathers. But we
> won't know until someone makes it. Sigh...
>
> Thanks for the info in advance.
> Norbert
>
>
